algorithm_technique: Graph traversal (DFS/BFS) with cycle detection and root identification
problem_summary_simple: Verify if given node connections form a single, valid binary tree.
problem_summary_technical: Identify the unique root, then perform a traversal (DFS/BFS) to ensure no cycles and all nodes are visited exactly once.
key_insights: A valid binary tree must have exactly one root (a node with no parent).
There should be no cycles in the node connections.
All 'n' nodes must be reachable from the root.
